content.description: Sit start the sharp arete. There is a foot hold that slides in and out of the cliff which is not needed for the sit start. Move up the arete using some holds on the right side of the arete. Easier if you use the yellow bucket hold.
content.location: This is on the left side wall.

content.description: This is a left-leaning offwidth problem in the Chum Bucket area going from 4" to 6" at the top. A knee fits in once you are off the ground.
content.protection: A pad and a spotter, the landing is on rocks on a slope.
content.location:
From blue trail, hike up a gully away from Walden Pond, then go up a pile of talus toward the cliff. It is in a left-facing corner.

 The coordinates are: 42°30'12.3"N 71°00'39.4"W.

content.description: Stand starting on jugs on the flake, and toe hook with your right foot at the end of the flake below the start of the crack. Get a good jam in the crack, and move up it.
content.location: It is to the right of the offwidth, ~30 feet away on the face you see walking up the hill to the offwidth.

content.description: Chum Bucket is a small cliff that hosts a thin, overhung face that should yield 2-3 hard problems. It also hosts a incredible looking overhung arete as well as a nice looking finger crack. Check out the photos.
